sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's Tuesday the 3rd of May. Good morning Europe, a very warm welcome to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Evacuations from Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks are stalled as Russia resumes its bombardment of the plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people remain trapped in the besieged Ukrainian city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Fears of a new battlefront after Russian missiles strike Ukraine's Black Sea port of Odessa, hitting a vital supply link to Romania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And the EU moves towards phasing out Russian oil imports by the end of the year. A slow trickle of people fleeing the devastated city of Mariupol are arriving in Zaporizhia

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: but not in the numbers Ukraine was hoping for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A first group of civilians trapped for weeks inside Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks are expected but efforts to save more people from the horrific conditions inside the huge plant have stalled those who've made it reveal what life has been like under the russian bombardment they bombed as of style for a month all the markets are destroyed all the shops are destroyed all drug stores destroyed All the shops are destroyed, all drugstores destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: No medicine, no food, nothing. And the children? I hope you never have to suffer like this. Never again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hundreds remain trapped in underground bunkers and tunnels beneath the steelworks, the last stronghold of resistance to Russia's siege.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There's no mention of wounded Ukrainian forces being included in any further evacuations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And across the rest of the city, there are still an estimated 130,000 people struggling to survive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But according to footage released by Russia-backed separatists, some Mariupol residents have returned to their destroyed homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You know, home is home. It may be damaged, but I have my own spoon, fork and plate here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Who needs me? If I go, I should take something with me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I won't go far with the pension I have. We don't plan to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But for others, there is no choice. It's very bad at our home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We don't have a house anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We don't have a city anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We left on Saturday and reached Vasilivka, but we couldn't leave as there was active fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Russian siege of Mariupol has left those trapped in dire conditions in a wider war which has uprooted 13 million people and killed thousands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian authorities say a Russian missile attack struck the Black Sea port of Odessa on Monday evening, killing a 15-year-old in a residential building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Earlier Moscow said it had also hit a railway bridge across the Dniester estuary west of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Its destruction cuts access to shipments of weapons and other cargo from neighboring Romania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Experts say the strike shows that Russia is opening a new battlefront in the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: East Ukraine continues to be Russia's main target.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Video of a historic school burning after being shelled in Luhansk was released by local authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The US has repeated its claim that Russia is planning to annex Donetsk and Luhansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: According to the most recent reports, we believe that Russia will try to annex the Donetsk People's Republic and Luhansk People's Republic, in quotes, so-called, to Russia. The reports state that Russia has plans to engineer referenda on joining Russia sometime in mid-May. In the Ukrainian capital, locals have begun rebuilding. Areas from north of the Kiev region were shelled and occupied by Russian troops just a month ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Once Russian forces withdrew, municipal emergency teams and volunteers started working to restore basic services such as electricity, water and gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: After Denmark became the first Nordic country to reopen its embassy in Kiev, Sweden Sweden is to follow suit on Wednesday after closing its embassy temporarily following Russia's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Brussels says it's preparing for some difficult months ahead in its energy sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: EU ministers in this field met on Monday for an extraordinary meeting to discuss the bloc's strategy after Russia decided to cut off gas to Poland and Bulgaria last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now the EU is working to ensure the continent's gas storage will be full by autumn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's currently at 32 per cent, and according to the commission in charge of energy, Kadri Simpson, any member state could be the next victim of Moscow's energy cuts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Brussels is also working in parallel on a sixth package of sanctions against Russia that will focus on a phased-out embargo of oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Germany, one of the main opponents, is now agreeing to it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: KASPER BUSCH, German Foreign Minister to the European Commission on Energy, Germany After two months of work, I can say Germany is not against an oil ban on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Of course, it is a heavy load to bear, but we are ready to do that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have to prepare the harbors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So time is helpful, but I think other countries have bigger problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT The proposal could be announced by the European Commission as soon as Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But for some experts, the plan must be handled with care as it has the potential to backfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: If we are now moving to sanction Russian oil with a gradual embargo, Russia might respond immediately by saying, okay, then we cut the gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And leaving Russia this strategic game at the end might not be the best option for the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It might be better for the EU to put a tariff immediately on both oil and gas coming from Russia into the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some countries are instead calling for a punitive import tax on Russian energy rather than an embargo. Christopher Pitcher, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our viewers at this stage must feel like they've been hearing about the potentiality

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: of a Russian oil embargo for weeks because of course it's been under discussion, intense discussion night and day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And, in fact, all last weekend, we saw European Commission officials pick up the phone lines and call the various EU capitals to gauge the temperature on how far they were willing to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Because member states like Hungary, for example, like Slovakia, also Italy, Austria, very much dependent on Russian oil and, of course, Russian natural gas and very reluctant to go for an embargo like this. So what we've heard is the European Commission as early as tomorrow will be coming out with a compromise proposal that could then be signed off on Wednesday by EU ambassadors. This compromise proposal would see a phase out of Russian oil by the end of the year perhaps and it would see special measures and exemptions for those countries who rely most on Russian oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And we've seen and heard from the German Minister today for Energy Robert Huyback very much in favour saying we are on board with this and we're looking at ways to make sure that it doesn't hurt Germany too much and of course Poland as well its neighbour saying that they'll step in and help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The US Supreme Court may be poised to overturn a 1973 ruling that legalized abortion nationwide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: If a draft of a majority opinion leaked to newspaper Politico is verified, it would represent a staggering blow to women's rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The draft opinion calls the landmark Roe v. Wade decision enshrining the right to abortion wrong from the start, and would leave the regulation of the procedure or its ban up to individual states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Several Republican-led states have already passed highly restrictive abortion laws in anticipation of such a ruling.
